call_title: Trustless Bitcoin Relay on Ergo | Alex Chepurnoy | ErgoHack VIII

decisions.decision: All code released in public domain for free use by non-commercial and commercial applications
decisions.speaker: kushti
decisions.context: Making the trustless Bitcoin relay code available for others to build upon
decisions.quote: All the code is in public domain as usually, so it can be absolutely freely used by non-commercial as well as commercial applications

open_questions.question: How to send back from Ergo to Bitcoin in a trustless way
open_questions.context: While Bitcoin to Ergo bridging is possible, the reverse direction remains problematic because trustless relay for Ergo on Bitcoin blockchain cannot be built

open_questions.question: Economic model for Relay incentives for submitting blocks
open_questions.context: Need to address transaction fees to miners and increased fees for submitting block headers

key_facts.fact: Trustless Bitcoin relay is a minimal Bitcoin client done as a contract on the Ergo blockchain, validating proof of work and storing Bitcoin block headers
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: First Bitcoin relay was launched on Ethereum, initially maybe a grant from Ethereum Foundation, currently supported by ConsenSys
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: Ethereum relay was too expensive and often behind the Bitcoin blockchain, making it unpopular
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: Nervos Blockchain recently utilized a relay to build RGB++ protocol
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: Contract relies on Sigma 6.0 features such as sign bits decoding
key_facts.speaker: kushti

key_facts.fact: Both contracts are tested and tests show they are working in a simulated blockchain
key_facts.speaker: kushti
